page.title: 12RECREATION
page.content: The Pub. The public house at Appley is called The Globe. It is a very old building and has been a pub for at least a hundred years and has been in the same family for much of that time. The Globe is the social centre for the area and becomes quite busy in the evenings. There is a garden for the children to play in. Nearly every week skittles are played in the pub's skittle alley between different teams. Fetes We hold a number of fetes each year. The church fete this year was at Stawley Mill. There was a treasure map,Pick a Straw, Spin the Wheel, a bottle stall and a book stall. Mrs Henson was selliong home made cakes. There were trout in the river next to the garden.
